ocp_details.derived_cost_desc: The cost based on the user’s defined price list. Calculated as infrastructure_cost + markup, or on a premises without infrastructure, calculated as CPU usage * rate.

aws_configure.cost_report: Create a cost and usage report using the following values:
aws_configure.enter_s3_bucket: Enter the name of the Amazon S3 bucket you just created in the S3 bucket field:
aws_configure.intro: To collect and store the information needed for cost management, you need to set up on Amazon S3 bucket for cost and  usage reports.
aws_configure.s3_bucket_account: Specify or create an Amazon S3 Bucket for your account.
aws_configure.s3_bucket_name_helper_text_invalid: S3 bucket name must start with alphanumeric character and can contain underscore and hyphen

configure.create_entry: The Usage Collector assumes that the default location for the OCP command line (oc) is /usr/bin/oc. If the oc command line is installed in a different location, supply the -e OCP_CLI=</path/to/oc> when you execute the ocp_usage.sh command.
configure.create_entry_title: Create an entry to run the OCP Usage collector every 45 minutes
configure.edit_contrab: The crontab user must have access to the file with metering operator token.
configure.instructions_text: To periodically upload data collected by the Usage Collector, you need to create a cron job using the following commands:
configure.note: The cron user will also need sudo authority to interact with the Red Hat Insights Client. Below is an example of the addition need to the /etc/sudoers file to provide password-less sudo for an example user ocpcollector:

enable_account_access.arn_helper_text_invalid: ARN should have at least 10 characters and must start with arn:aws:
enable_account_access.copy_arn: From the Summary screen, copy the role ARN and paste it in the ARN field:
enable_account_access.instructions_title: Enable account access: Identify your role Amazon resource name (ARN)
enable_account_access.intro: To enable account access, capture the ARN associated with the role you just created.
enable_account_access.select_role: From the Roles tab, select the role you just created.

iam_policy.complete_process: Complete the process to create your new policy
iam_policy.instructions_title: Enable account access: Create IAM policy
iam_policy.intro: To grant premissions to cost management reports you just configured, create an AWS identity access management (IAM) policy.
iam_policy.new_policy: Create a new policy, pasting the following content into the JSON text box.
iam_policy.note: You will need to be logged in to the IAM Console to compute the next step.

iam_role.attach_permissions: Attach the permissions policy that you just created.
iam_role.complete_process: Complete the process to create your new role.
iam_role.create_new_role: From the AWS Identity Access Management console, create a new role.
iam_role.instructions_title: Enable account access: Create IAM role
iam_role.intro: To delegate account access, create an IAM role to associate with your IAM policy.
iam_role.paste_account_id: Select another AWS Account from the list of trusted entities and paste the following value into the Account ID field:

korekuta.checklist_title: You will need the following information in hand during the installation:
korekuta.download_and_install: Download and install the {{korekuta}} on the same system where the Red Hat Insights client is installed.
korekuta.instructions_text: The Usage Collector connects to your cluster and collects the usage data needed for cost management.
korekuta.instructions_title: Download and configure the Usage Collector
korekuta.post_installation: When installation and configuration are complete, you receive confirmation message containing a cluster identifier. Enter that value in the cluster identifier field:

obtain_login.intro: To gather RHOCP metering data, you need to obtain the login token for your Operator Metering service account.
obtain_login.obtain_token: Log into the RHOCP cluster with an account that has access to the Operator Metering namespace
obtain_login.run_command: Run the following command to obtain your login token:
obtain_login.security: To maintain security, place the token file ocp_usage_token on a file system with limited access.

source_kind.checkbox_1: You must be running OCP version 3.11 or newer.
source_kind.checkbox_2: You must install {{operator}} on your OCP cluster.
source_kind.checkbox_3: You must install and configure the {{insights}} on a system with network access to your OCP cluster.
source_kind.checkbox_4: You must install {{ansible}} and the {{epel}} on the system where the Red Hat Insights Client is installed.
source_kind.checkbox_5: You must install the {{oc}} on the system where the Red Hat Insights Client is installed.
source_kind.checklist_title: Before you begin confirm you meet the following requirements:
source_kind.instructions_text: To import data for cost management, you need to connect to a data source. To begin, select the source you want to collect data from.

overview.ocp_desc: Calculated platform cost (based on a price list) + cloud infrastructure cost.
overview.ocp_on_aws_desc: Calculated cost only: OpenShift Container Platform costs calculated using a price list. These metrics do not include the cloud infrastructure cost.
overview.title: Cost Management Overview
overview.title_aria_label: A description of OpenShift on AWS, OpenShift, and AWS

providers.bucket_error: Bucket name cannot contain spaces, special chars and be more than 255 characters
providers.empty_state_desc: Add a source, like an Amazon Web Services account, to see a total cost breakdown as well as usage information like instance counts and storage.
providers.resource_name_error: Provider resource name must begin with "arn:aws:"

delete.cancel: No, I would like to keep it
delete.error: Ops! There was a problem while deleting the source.
delete.message: Are you sure you want to delete this source? This action will remove any data related to this source permanently.
delete.title: Delete Source

no_sources.desc: To use Cost Management to manage your cloud costs, you must connect the application to at least one data source.
no_sources.sub_desc: Add an AWS account or an OpenShift Container Platform cluster to get started.
no_sources.title: No sources are configured
